page.title: 16Settlements-Bramshott
page.content: There are church registers that date from 1560, and are now held at the County Archives,{Winchester.} From those interviewed more than a quarter are commuters who travel to London by car and train. Many preferred shopping in bulk at a supermarket which is hardly surprising since the village has no shops. Apart from a post box opposite the church and a bus stop and phone box situated on the A3 just outside the village, there are no services in{Bramshott.} Travelling by car is necessary in order to obtain goods and services. For electrical goods people go to {Guildford.}The cinema is unpopular and so are the West End theatres. People spend their holidays either in Britain or on the continent.
